intro: Verbascum melhanense, commonly known as the Melhan's mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are broad and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Verbascum melhanense is often found in high-altitude areas, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
